name: 書報討論（一）
restrict: 允許重複修 ◎課程開放上修
goals: Enable students to gain reasoning ability of mathematical algorithms.
Equip students with the ability of electrical and electronic simulation design and demonstration.
Enable students to learn to plan the system from the original design to the execution of the completed system.
Learn to analyze problems and solve problems from the discussion process.
Generate ideas through brain storms and cultivate the ability to create inventions.
Achieve the goal of self-growth by learning from each other and adjusting research methods.
Allows students to learn communication skills and a cooperative attitude from open-ended discussions.
Learn professional ethics and service concepts through expert speeches.
Strengthen foreign language communication skills by a PPT presentation in English.
syllabus:
16+2 weeks (Lessen giving from Week 1 to 16; Self learning in Week 17 and 18)

Week #1: Introduction to the development of electrical and electronic technology and arrangement of discussion progress

Week #2 to #6: Expert and scholar speeches

Week #7 to #9: Graduate students report experience and research progresses

Week #10: Expert and scholar speech

Week #11: Graduate students report experience and research progresses

Week #12: Expert and scholar speech

Week #13: Graduate students report experience and research progresses

Week #14: Expert and scholar speech

Week #15: Graduate students report experience and research progresses

Week #16: Expert and scholar speech

Weeks #17 and #18: Self learning

methodologies.note: Invite experts and scholars to give speeches.
An open-ended discussion; students who ask questions will be given extra points.
Issues encountered by publishers will be resolved through open discussions.
The reporting format is multimedia integrated.

grading.note: Students are encouraged to participate in the discussion, and students who ask questions will be given extra points.
Each participant in the discussion has a record of check-in, and absentees must take leave.

1. Oral presentation time 18 ~ 20 minutes. (60% for second-year graduate students) 2. After listening to a speech in each class, a report writing is required. (40% for second-year graduate students; 100% for first-year graduate students)

prerequisite: The course can be retaken ◎Available for junior and senior year B.A. program students (Doctoral program courses excepted) and M.A. program students.
